task.summary: feat(blog): adds 5 new blog articles to the website
feat(blog): removes old blog articles and updates footer copyright
feat(TokenController): implement registration and login methods for JWT authentication
feat(blog): update hero image for Blazor WebAssembly JWT post

feat(blog): update Angular, Bootstrap and Firebase versions (master)
This commit updates the blog post about building an Angular project with Bootstrap and Firebase to reflect the latest versions of each technology:
- Angular 17 - Bootstrap 5 - Firebase 9
It also includes updates to the code examples, explanations, and screenshots to ensure accuracy and relevance.

feat(blog): update blog posts and hero images (master)
This commit updates the following blog posts:
- Building Windows App With Wpf: Updated the hero image. - Csharp Dictionaries: Updated the hero image and added a section about Immutable Dictionaries.
The updates aim to enhance the visual appeal and provide more comprehensive information to the readers.

feat(blog): update blog categories and post metadata (master)
This commit introduces several updates to blog posts and categories:
- Updates hero images for blog posts: "Building Windows App With Wpf" and "Csharp Dictionaries". - Adds a new section about Immutable Dictionaries to the "Csharp Dictionaries" blog post. - Updates the blog categories to better reflect the content. - Updates the "How to Use Redis Caching With ASP.NET Core and .NET 7" blog post to improve readability.
These updates aim to enhance the blog's organization, visual appeal, and provide more comprehensive information to readers.
Updates blog post category for the Sidecar pattern.

feat(blog): Update Redis Caching article for .NET 8 (master)
This commit updates the "How to Use Redis Caching With ASP.NET Core and .NET 7" blog post to reflect the latest changes in .NET 8.
The updated article now:
- Targets .NET 8 and updates code examples accordingly. - Uses the `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.StackExchangeRedis` package. - Configures Redis in `Program.cs` instead of `Startup.cs`. - Includes a new section on advanced Redis caching techniques such as serialization, distributed locking, and cache invalidation strategies. - Updates the screenshots and references.
These updates provide a comprehensive guide for using Redis caching with ASP.NET Core and .NET 8.

feat(blog): Update Redis Caching article for .NET 8 (master)
This commit updates the "How to Use Redis Caching With ASP.NET Core and .NET 7" blog post to reflect the latest changes in .NET 8.
The updated article now:
- Targets .NET 8 and updates code examples accordingly. - Uses the `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.StackExchangeRedis` package. - Configures Redis in `Program.cs` instead of `Startup.cs`. - Includes a new section on advanced Redis caching techniques such as serialization, distributed locking, and cache invalidation strategies. - Updates the screenshots and references.
These updates provide a comprehensive guide for using Redis caching with ASP.NET Core and .NET 8.
